TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IDacOperations

Docs.summary: Includes operations for importing and exporting Azure SQL Databases into and out of Azure blob storage.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Sql.Models.DacImportExportResponse> ExportAsync (string serverName, Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Sql.Models.DacExportParameters parameters, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Sql.Models.DacImportExportResponse> ExportAsync(string serverName, class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Sql.Models.DacExportParameters parameters, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the Azure SQL Database Server in which the database to export resides.
The parameters needed to initiate the export request.
Docs.summary: Exports an Azure SQL Database into a DACPAC file in Azure Blob Storage.
Docs.returns: Represents the response that the service returns once an import or export operation has been initiated.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Sql.Models.DacGetStatusResponse> GetStatusAsync (string serverName, string fullyQualifiedServerName, string username, string password, string requestId, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Sql.Models.DacGetStatusResponse> GetStatusAsync(string serverName, string fullyQualifiedServerName, string username, string password, string requestId, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the server in which the import or export operation is taking place.
The fully qualified domain name of the Azure SQL Database Server where the operation is taking place. Example: a9s7f7s9d3.database.windows.net
The administrator username for the Azure SQL Database Server.
The administrator password for the Azure SQL Database Server.
The request ID of the operation being queried. The request ID is obtained from the responses of the import and export operations.
Docs.summary: Gets the status of the import or export operation in the specified server with the corresponding request ID. The request ID is provided in the responses of the import or export operation.
Docs.returns: Represents a list of import or export status values returned from GetStatus.

Docs.param: The name of the server in which the import or export operation is taking place.
The parameters needed to get the status of an import or export operation.
Docs.summary: Gets the status of the import or export operation in the specified server with the corresponding request ID. The request ID is provided in the responses of the import or export operation.
Docs.returns: Represents a list of import or export status values returned from GetStatus.

Docs.param: The name of the Azure SQL Database Server into which the database is being imported.
The parameters needed to initiated the Import request.
